Each_item.News_content: Dow stocks are showing a mixed trend today with some key players experiencing notable shifts. Intel (INTC) reported better-than-expected earnings, while Travelers Companies Inc. (TRV) is under pressure due to rising claims costs. Visa (V) announced a new partnership that could boost its global presence. American Express (AXP) and UnitedHealth Group (UNH) remain stable despite market volatility. Boeing (BA) continues to face challenges related to production delays.

McDonald's (MCD) released a statement confirming strong Q3 sales growth driven by digital initiatives. United Technologies (UTX) is exploring strategic options for its aerospace segment. Nike (NKE) stock surged after announcing a new sustainable product line. Goldman Sachs (GS) reported higher-than-expected revenue, driven by trading activity.

Verizon (VZ) announced plans to expand its 5G network coverage significantly over the next two years. Cisco Systems (CSCO) faces potential regulatory scrutiny over a recent acquisition. General Electric (GE) continues restructuring efforts but remains in focus due to ongoing financial challenges. Pfizer (PFE) and 3M (MMM) both reported solid quarterly results, bolstering investor confidence.

Home Depot (HD) saw robust sales growth attributed to increased home improvement projects during the pandemic. Walmart (WMT) announced an expansion of its e-commerce capabilities. Apple (AAPL) stock gained momentum following positive analyst coverage on iPhone demand. Disney (DIS) reported mixed results as streaming service growth offsets theme park losses.
